page.title: 01BILSDALE:GAZETEER.
page.content: SCENERY: A valley in hills rising to 1,000 ft. The land is moorland with rough grazing: sparse deciduous woodland and one conifer wood.Remains of an earthwork, jet mines and sandstone quarries.Farming is the main occupation.Two long distance footpaths cross this block;the Lyke Wake Walk and the White Rose Walk. BUILDINGS: 22 Private residences, 2 churches 2 chapels, one unused, village hall and 1 public house. AMENITIES: Bus service, Electricity, Milk Delievery, Mobile Butcher,Fish van and Library.Post box, Telephones, Water and School. ACTIVITIES:Bilsdale Band, A Show, A Hunt, Cricket Club, Dance Band, Study Group and Sunday School.
